intro: Carex gagaensis, commonly known as the Gaga sedge, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of southern Africa. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes grass-like plants known as sedges. The plant features slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically green or brown in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in marshy areas or along the edges of water bodies. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
